artofillusion.boundingsphere

Class GeoFit

  • java.lang.Object
    • artofillusion.boundingsphere.GeoFit

  • public class GeoFit
extends java.lang.Object
    GeoFit is an algorithm to define a minimal bounding sphere for a set of points in 3D-space, applying a few simple geometrical rules.

    The algoritm always produces perfect fit (or so it seems so far) within obtainable numerical accuracy.

    Version:
    0.02, May-04-2019, for Art of Illusion
    Author:
    Petri Ihalainen, (peteihis)

    • Method Detail

      • boundingSphere

        public BoundingSphere boundingSphere(Vec3[] vertex)
        Calculate a bounding sphere for a set of vertices.

      • boundingSphere

        public BoundingSphere boundingSphere(ObjectInfo info)
        Calculate a bounding sphere for an object on in a scene. If no preview mesh is available the bounding box is used.

      • boundingSphere

        public BoundingSphere boundingSphere(java.util.ArrayList<ObjectInfo> infoList)
        Calculate a bounding sphere for a group of objects

      • fastSphere

        public BoundingSphere fastSphere(Vec3[] vertex)
        Calculate a non-minimal 2-pass bounding sphere for a set of vertices. The center is the AABB-center and the radius is the distance to the most distant point from that.

      • fastSphere

        public BoundingSphere fastSphere(ObjectInfo info)
        Calculate a non-minimal 2-pass bounding sphere for an object in a scene. The center is the AABB-center and the radius is the distance to the most distant point from that.

        If no preview mesh is available, boununding box corners are used instead.

      • fastSphere

        public BoundingSphere fastSphere(java.util.ArrayList<ObjectInfo> infoList)
        Calculate a non-minimal 2-pass bounding sphere for a group of objects. The center is the AABB-center and the radius is the distance to the most distant point from that.

      • boxCenter

        public Vec3 boxCenter(Vec3[] vertex)
        Calculates the "box center" (AABB center) for a set of vertices.
